docs.lead_paragraph: Neither testosterone replacement nor the widely sold anti-aging diet supplement DHEA has any discernible beneficial effects in elderly people, a new study suggests. DHEA, or dehydroepiandrosterone, is a legally sold dietary supplement, although its use is banned by many amateur and professional sports organizations.

headline.main: No Gain for Elderly From DHEA or Testosterone

docs.abstract: Dr K Sreekumaran Nair, Mayo Clinic College of Medicine professor, leads study on reported benefits of elderly people taking DHEA, hormone supplement, and receiving testosterone replacement; research, which is published in New England Journal of Medicine, finds that although levels of each hormone increased in study participants, there were no measurable health benefits associated with increase; drawing (M)
